channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. military buildup near Iran reaches critical level. And, Trump's plans for Gaza
item.description: The U.S. buildup in the Middle East has reached a critical mass that could put pressure on Iran in negotiations. And, Trump unveils big plans for Gaza during the first-ever Board of Peace meeting.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. buildup in the Middle East has reached a critical mass that could put pressure on Iran in negotiations. And, Trump unveils big plans for Gaza during the first-ever Board of Peace meeting.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: What I learned watching every sport at the Winter Olympics
item.description: Sit down with pop culture critic Linda Holmes as she watches the 2026 Winter Games. She is exhausted by cross-country, says "ow ow ow" during moguls, and makes the case, once and for all, for curling.
item.content:encoded:
Sit down with pop culture critic Linda Holmes as she watches the 2026 Winter Games. She is exhausted by cross-country, says "ow ow ow" during moguls, and makes the case, once and for all, for curling.

(Image credit: Gabriel Bouys)
item.dc:creator: Linda Holmes

item.title: Scientists worry about lasting damage from Potomac sewage spill
item.description: Drinking water around the District of Columbia hasn't been contaminated. But scientists say the environmental damage could be severe.
item.content:encoded:
Drinking water around the District of Columbia hasn't been contaminated. But scientists say the environmental damage could be severe.

(Image credit: Nathan Ellgren)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: 'We were scared': Man recalls the night he nearly launched a nuclear missile
item.description: In 1974, Lt. Colonel Randall Lanning manned the launch controls that could deploy nuclear weapons in the event of a Soviet attack. He looks back at one night that's still etched in his memory.
item.content:encoded: In 1974, Lt. Colonel Randall Lanning manned the launch controls that could deploy nuclear weapons in the event of a Soviet attack. He looks back at one night that's still etched in his memory.
item.dc:creator: Esther Honig

item.title: What worked and what didn't with a cellphone ban at a Kentucky school
item.description: Keeping students off their devices is the new norm in many schools. We talked to students and educators at one Kentucky school to see how it's working.
item.content:encoded:
Keeping students off their devices is the new norm in many schools. We talked to students and educators at one Kentucky school to see how it's working.

(Image credit: Lydia Schweickart for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Sequoia Carrillo

item.title: Using saliva to detect disease holds promise, but it's not perfected yet
item.description: Easier than a blood test, saliva tests have the potential to detect cavities, infections and even cancer. But a lack of insurance coverage and other obstacles stand in the way of wider use.
item.content:encoded:
Easier than a blood test, saliva tests have the potential to detect cavities, infections and even cancer. But a lack of insurance coverage and other obstacles stand in the way of wider use.

(Image credit: dusanpetkovic)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Israeli settlers kill 19-year-old Palestinian American, officials and witnesses say
item.description: Israeli settlers in the occupied West Bank shot and killed a Palestinian American man during an attack on a village, the Palestinian Health Ministry said.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli settlers in the occupied West Bank shot and killed a Palestinian American man during an attack on a village, the Palestinian Health Ministry said.

(Image credit: Nasser Nasser)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump says he doesn't know if aliens are real but directs government to release files on UFOs
item.description: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he's directing the Pentagon and other government agencies to release files related to extraterrestrials and UFOs because of "tremendous interest."
item.content:encoded:
President Donald Trump said Thursday that he's directing the Pentagon and other government agencies to release files related to extraterrestrials and UFOs because of "tremendous interest."

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump warns of 'bad things' if Iran doesn't make a deal, as second U.S. carrier nears Mideast
item.description: Iran held annual military drills with Russia on Thursday as a second American aircraft carrier drew closer to the Middle East.
item.content:encoded:
Iran held annual military drills with Russia on Thursday as a second American aircraft carrier drew closer to the Middle East.

(Image credit: Masoud Nazari Mehrabi/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Eric Dane, 'Grey's Anatomy' star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
item.description: Eric Dane, the celebrated actor best known for his roles on "Grey's Anatomy" and "Euphoria" and who later in life became an advocate for ALS awareness, died Thursday. He was 53.
item.content:encoded:
Eric Dane, the celebrated actor best known for his roles on "Grey's Anatomy" and "Euphoria" and who later in life became an advocate for ALS awareness, died Thursday. He was 53.

(Image credit: Jordan Strauss)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
